Reviews.Title: “Great hotel located minutes from airport.”
Reviews.Author: Dacougr32
Reviews.Content: Great little motel located on Marina 5 min from Airport. Point Loma Seafood restaurant next to hotel has great fish-chips and Pizza Nova restaurant a short walk from hotel down Marina. Excellent wood fired pizza and outstanding salads + great beer. Free Wi-Fi in room with no password needed. Nicly remodeled rooms and bathrooms A+++

Reviews.Title: “average but priced right”
Reviews.Author: dorisplum
Reviews.Content: The room was average and parts of the bathroom door and window needed paint and a tidy up but the bathroom itself was nice enough. the bed was comfortable. there was a microwave and a fridge which is great to have. The room size was ok, there was a table in it also and internet. Breakfast was sweet buns, muffins, cereal, coffee, fruit and juice. for the price it was good. Also close to walk to restaurants and marina. would have been nice to have a laundry on site. we walked 2 short blocks to a launderette which wasn't so bad. I booked online and got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Rejamrodig
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night for a quick business trip. Beds were comfortable. Bathroom looked recently remodeled. From our room, we could see the harbor. Ironing board and Iron worked fine, as did everything in the room. All the front desk staff were super friendly. Muffins and fruit for breakfast in the lobby were a nice surprise! We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing and clean”
Reviews.Author: moderntourist
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by Jesse the manager, and his friendly staff. Great value. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: wildcatgrad07
Reviews.Content: I got there late at night and got help right away. I was happy with my room and the cleaness of the room. I had a good nite stay there and was happy with the customer service there.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking”
Reviews.Author: awalkr
Reviews.Content: Dirty, old, small & overpriced. Run in the other direction. The only reason we stayed here was because it allowed dogs to stay- with $10 extra fee. When we arrived the desk clerk was on his phone on a personal call and took him a few minutes to help me since he had to finish his call first. Then the hotel keys didn't work. The site advertises "newly remodeled rooms", however the rooms are old, small and dirty. Beer bottle caps found on floor in the room & someone else's hair in our unused towels. My husband and I wondered if the sheets were changed between guests. The TV picture was messed up. Very Noisy- you can hear anything from people flushing toilets to talking or watching tv in the next room. We were woken up at 2 am by a crowd of people yelling in the parking lot- one of them bragging about everything he had stollen that day. Called front desk, but noise level continued. The hotel offers free parking- but good luck finding it. There are limited spots in the crammed parking lot- my car was hit while parked there. The hotel site advertises heated pool- too cold for us! Site also advertised free breakfast which we were told upon arrival was a muffin and cup of coffee. On a good note: Decent location near- not on the water, Very close to the Airport, and only about 10 min to get to the Gaslamp Quarter. As far as dog friendliness- not very many places to walk puppy to do his business. I wouldn't pay more than $40 for a room here. BUT if you do stay here- stop by Mitches seafood for dinner. Very good fish!! And only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Best for fishing out of Point Loma”
Reviews.Author: wduckman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for those taking a fishing charter for a day or a week. The rooms are decent and comfprtable and there is very little noise on a Saturday night. Beds are decent bt the decor, TV, etc., are dated. A very average room but perfect for the money. The best thing is proximity to charter boats and the continental breakfast. Best Tip: the parking lot is small, but you can pay to park overnight if fishing.

Reviews.Title: “Average, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Cinnne
Reviews.Content: Rooms were average, kind of on the small side. Lobby was tiny and this is where they served continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: PereAhmed
Reviews.Content: One of the constant problems with reviews on TripAdvisor is that some reviewers seem to forget that they are paying for pot roast while expecting prime rib. The Vagabond Inn at Point Loma falls into the "pot roast" category - which can be great as long as you are expecting it. We stayed there for a couple of nights in early September and we found it entirely adequate, which is what we were paying for. here's what we got: 1) a clean, renovated bathroom - a bit small, but we didn't have any bathroom parties planned, so it wasn't a disappointment; 2) a smallish room with a view of a parking lot (but the bed was big and comfortable, and there was room to sort out our stuff - again, we didn't expect to be playing touch football in there); 3) a hard-working but functional refrigerator; 4) a television that probably worked but it didn't matter since we never turned it on; 5) a decent location close to the things that we wanted to see and do, with plenty of coffee shops, convenience stores and restauraunts within easy walking distance; 6) a pleasant desk attendant; 7) the "free" breakfast that you would expect - fruit, pastries, coffee and juice; 8) free parking; 9) a pool that we didn't use but which seemed clean and would have come in handy if it the weather had been hotter (we missed the heat wave by a week). Are there downsides? You bet. The room smelled damp and clammy when we arrived, but it improved when we turned on the A/C to get some circulation. The decor is somewhat dated and might come across as shabby, but it was clean and neat. The room WAS smallish, as I said - and with two big suitcases plus peripheral stuff we had to be judicious in how we spread ourselves around. That said, it was as big as most European hotel rooms that I have ever been in. The hotel is wedged between a busy fish market and the street, and the pool is street-side. But people were using and enjoying the pool, and the high fence between the pool deck and the street offers security if not privacy. Even though it seems like it would be a noisy place, it wasn't - at least, not when we stayed there. Don't go to the Vagabond Inn if you are looking for a high-end hotel experience. You won't get that. But if you are looking for a place that offers basic accommodation at a reasonable price, the Vagabond fits the bill. I'll have the pot roast, please.

Reviews.Title: “Pokey hole”
Reviews.Author: Ranchito1
Reviews.Content: It's an old hotel despite its renovation of the bathrooms (cheap job). Unfriendly staff. Dirty room. The armchair had animal hair on the cushion. We pulled it out so the cleaner could see it and at least vacuum it. Nope. Breakfast is a joke - danish and cheap muffins. The pool is very small and not attractive. Not worth the lower SD price. The neighborhood is not attractive ans eerily deserted at night. Check out Cabrillo National Monument about 3 miles away. Nice views from the rocks down at the base of Point Loma. Watch out for the waves. It would be impossible to get out if you get swept in.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, And they allow pets”
Reviews.Author: Squirrel4
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. We got free Wi-fi. I like the fact that the pool is heated. The service was good. The free parking was nice. The location is 10 min away from main visit points in san diego. In general, i enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: KansasTraveler601
Reviews.Content: Our ten night stay at the Vagabond Inn on Point Loma was great. Rooms are comfortably furnished with newly remodeled bathrooms. This location gets you away from the noise and traffic of the city although you're only five minutes from the airport.Parking is free--a bonus in this city. The pool was warm and included both shallow and deep areas--good for adult swimming and kid playing. The desk staff is very accommodating and the cleaning staff did a fine job of cleaning up the beach sand we managed to track in. A great bargain in our favorite expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: catfish2
Reviews.Content: We were there for almost 3 weeks. The rooms are not fancy, but clean. We looked at many of the small hotels in the neighborhood and liked this one best. Beds comfortable. Linens in good condition. Continental breakfast in the small lobby had Great chocolate croissant, other pastries, fruit, juice and coffee. Staff was friendly and helpful. Price was reasonable. We could not have found a better location. A short walk to many excellent restaurants. Close to downtown, but with a neighborhood feeling. All daily needs services within walking distance. (less than 5 blocks)

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SSuperH
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Cali for 5 days on a road trip... Have myself, husband and 2 teens. This was the BEST hotel and OUTSTANDING price!! We are not stuffy snobbish people looking to blow hundreds on a bed so this was perfect!! Very clean, most comfy bed so far, staff was awesome! Rooms were updated and cute.. Marina right outside with neat view in back! VERY COMFY BED again.. Lol! We'll stay here on our next trip for more nights instead of wasting it on cheap roach motels!! :-) nice pastry, fruit, juice and coffee breakfast... Sweet bathroom with indie feel overall

Reviews.Title: “Just like their moto great place and friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Angela0102
Reviews.Content: This place is just right, very clean comfy beds and very friendly staff. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance next to the harbor. I just want to thank the staff at The Vagabond inn for making my stay very plesant.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd stayed somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: alldon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights and booked ater staying in a Vagabond Inn in Palm Springs. Unfortunately this one was not of the same standard. The room was under an overhang so very dark. The included breakfast was minimal and served in the tiny reception area. the pool wa small and faced on to the road. The receptionist although he was polite and tried to be helpfulhad no information on local restaurants or a corkscrew. The motel is at Point Loma, the marina area, and is quite a way from downtown San diego. It is also close to the airport but there is no night flying.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Crash”
Reviews.Author: marmot1995
Reviews.Content: Just wanted a room in a safe place to crash while exploring the area. Both bathroom and room were acceptably clean. Nothing out of the ordinary. Definitely an older hotel, with some cracks in bathroom caulking, etc...but nothing horrible. Linens were in decent condition. There is a fair amount of traffic noise, and like most hotels, you can hear things from upstairs or down the hall. The front desk staff was great. Low key but super friendly and helpful. They were far better than the customer service at the fancier restaurant I went to for valentine's day. 24 hour coffee, danishes/muffins for breakfast. 15 minutes or so from central parts of San Diego. Good sushi place nearby too. If you're looking for an affordable place to crash, as opposed to a luxurious room, this is definitely a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: petfamily
Reviews.Content: I found this on officialpethotels.com and it was a great value! The location is perfect for leisurely dog walks and it's close to dog beaches. The room was clean and neat. We will definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: sail731
Reviews.Content: A great choice to stay at if you are on a budget and looking for the Point Loma location. Close to the airport also. This hotel is small and dated, though offers walking distance to the fishing docks and also local neighborhood restaurants and shops. Very close to the San Diego Yacht Club. Rooms have all of the basics and cont. breakfast is included.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: chri5t0ph
Reviews.Content: Great location. Point Loma is an excellent place to stay if you're in San Diego. A bit off track regarding the tram, however europeeans who love a bit of a walk should love this place. The room was clean although a bit smelly. Nothing you would care about after 10 minutes. Very friendly and helpful staff, free coffee all day. Not that big of an breakfast however enough to get started in the morning. We had a room with a window to the restaurant and the harbour next to the hotel, however we did not experience any noise what so ever. Also plenty of free wireless with several hotspots that cover the hotel. I absolutely loved it and consider the price it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Killer location, friendly staff, clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: TiszaVancouver
Reviews.Content: I've averaged 45 stays per year at the Point Loma Vagabond Inn for the past 3 years and have come to love this value gem in San Diego. The front staff are extremely hospitable and courteous, the rooms impeccably clean, comfortable and utterly serviceable. Close to airport, great walks and restaurants. The pool is warm and clean. The neighbourhood is a busy location, and the fishing industry starts early, so earplugs are useful if you plan to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “We Were Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LeisureMan_99
Reviews.Content: I had searched for value accommodations in the San Diego area and chose this one primarily for the positive reviews. I reserved a double room plenty in advance of our stay. We arrived at about 9:00pm, and I went to the front desk to check in. The check-in process seemed to take longer than I would have expected, and finally the gentleman at the desk asked if we would be willing to upgrade to a room with a king bed, pull-out couch, and kitchenette. I agreed, we got the keys, and we went to the room. I opened the door and found the bed unmade, towels on the floor, and trash from the previous people on the table. Obviously, the room had not been cleaned. I told the man at the desk and asked if we could just get the room we originally had reserved. He said they didn't have one because their last double had broken down (I suspect it had already been given away.) He then said he would get housekeeping to come clean the room if we could wait just a while. We left for about 20 minutes and then returned to find the room at least looking clean, but I had a bad feeling about a quick clean job that late at night. In addition, the room had a very musty odor to it every time we returned to it. At check-out I was asked, "How was your stay?" So I told the above story, but the person at the desk just said, "Oh." The bottom line was we didn't get the room we asked for, the room we got was not ready and was prepared hastily, the room had a musty odor, and we received no offer of compensation for our inconvenience. Based on these reasons, I would probably not stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for price”
Reviews.Author: Islandloveraz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to San Diego quite often and are pretty familiar with the area. We considered all options from the Sheraton Hotel and Marina, Holiday Inn, Embassy Suites, Bay Club hotel, to the Super 8. We donâ€™t spend much time in the room so we are mostly concerned with location, cleanliness, and value/price. Yes, there are times where I would pay for incredible views, hot tub, spa features and an elegant room but not all the time since we do travel a lot. On earlier trips, we drove by the Vagabond Inn while it was getting updated/refurbished and wondered how the rooms looked. We decided to book a couple of nights and see what we thought and ended up extending our stay there. What did I like? The room was clean. The bed was comfortable. Refrigerator and microwave in room. Coffee maker in room. Great location. NO parking fees (which can really add up). These fees can be hidden charges at the other hotels and you wonâ€™t be told at check-in. Manager on site who is friendly and on top of any problems you may have Staff friendly Continental Breakfast (fruits and pastries) Free Internet What did I not like? People in nonsmoking rooms smoke outside their room which some of that smoke can get into your room when you open your door. Hole in our bedspread. If I would have been picky, I know this would have been changed out ASAP due to the manager being very accommodating. Overall, great value for price. I will stay there again. Have already recommended this place to friends. Also, we stayed on the first floor near the office/pool. Not sure if all rooms have been updated but I am pretty sure they have been. -Miguel's Restaurant is just a block away - excellent Mexican food -Point Loma Seafoods is right behind the hotel. Great smoked fish and other seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bummed Out By The Vagabond!”
Reviews.Author: REAL-E-REAL
Reviews.Content: We liked the Vagabond very much! The Vagabond is a nice little inexpensive place to stay while checking out San Diego attractions. I was drawn to it by some reviews I'd read, the location and the price. The staff is easy going and friendly. The room was clean, beds were comfortable. Our room had a desk, T.V., refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and free wi-fi. The free breakfast consisted of coffee, fruit, muffins and pastries. Coffee was always available in the lobby. There isn't an on site laundry. There's a coin op laundry about four or five small blocks away but it was closed while we were there. I drove less than 2 miles to another coin laundry called Ocean Breeze Wash & Dry. Its address is 4745 Point Loma Ave, San Diego, 92107. It was very nice and I folded my clothes while looking out at the ocean. I was there at around 9 am on a Saturday morning and had no trouble getting machines. One thing that I though would be a good reason for staying at the Vagabond was the Fish Market next door where you can get fresh sandwiches, tacos, crab cakes etc.. I was less than impressed by the food and the prices were very high. We had a fabulous dinner at Filippis Pizza Grotto (address 1747 India St, San Diego, CA 92101). Filippis is in Little Italy, about 4 miles from the Vagabond. Other things that are next door is a Whale Watching boat trip company and fishing trip service company. I wish we'd had time for those. I'm sure I'll be visiting this Vagabond Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place we've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: jweldy
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this motel due to its proximity to the San Diego Airport. My husband had booked the room online, and said it had gotten fairly good reviews, and since we were only going to be in the room for about 12 hours, a budget motel should be o.k. Upon first glance inside the room, everything looked 'o.k.' When I went to check out the bathroom, however, that's when my heart sank a bit. There was a bunch of hair stuck in the bathtub train, clearly visible, leading me to believe the room hadn't been cleaned. There was a yellow stain on the bath towel. I also was slightly horrified that there was a window at eye level in the bathroom, facing directly into the motel walkway. Now, this window was "frosted", but I could clearly see people when they would walk by, so I'm sure they could at least see me to some degree--very uncomfortable. There were stains on the walls; the carpet looked like it had not been vacuumed in a decade, and worst of all, when I went to go to bed, there were a bunch of dark hairs on the sheets. I made my husband go down to the front desk to ask for new sheets. He offered to move us to another room, and apologized, but our two kids were already asleep in bed, so we just got new sheets. The shower took forever to get hot water (like 10 minutes), so I had to just settle for washing with a washcloth that night. In the morning, I felt so dirty from being in that bed/room that I did decide to take a shower and take my chances. I was never so happy to check out of that place. My husband asked for a refund in the morning, but the manager said he couldn't do that. The only pro to this place is that it's close to the airport. Unless you are really financially strapped and don't mind dirty disgusting rooms , I would not recommend staying at this motel. I felt dirty just being in that room, and kept praying that I didn't contract any diseases from being there.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: bettyboop0429
Reviews.Content: This place is excellent, they really go the extra mile as soon as you walk in the door. Rooms are clean and mattress real comfortable. The evening clerk even printed my boarding passes for free. I also had free wi-fi. Nice heated pool. Over all I had a great time, Cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Had I seen in it the day first, I would have ran...”
Reviews.Author: jl21Va
Reviews.Content: This place looked a little sketchy and had few amenities, but when you arrive at 2:30 AM (late flight) and leave at 6:30 AM for some diving (with nearby shop - Dive California) then it serves its purpose. A small but clean room to crash in for a few hours. Very close to the airport which is nice when your plane arrives after the rental car companies close! I honestly thought they were joking about the breakfast. If you enjoy standing while you eat a muffin next to the front desk, then this is the place for you. The once positive though was, as I mentioned, the room was clean. Oh and the price was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesBones
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this Hotel was one of the Best Hotels that me and my family have ever stayed at. The price was reasonable for the weekend and for all of the extra perks that it had to offer. We asked for directions to Sea World and the morning clerk was so helpful and even printed out our directions for us. It made our weekend so relaxing. They even gave us a coupon for a Free Appetizer at this little Mexican Restaurant down the street which we gladly accepted and used. My kids loved the cookies at 3:00pm and the pool was nice and refreshing. The only thing I wish was the rooms were a little bigger, with us being a family of 4, you need the extra space.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good value”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinRidgewalker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had never traveled to San Diego before, so we wanted a place close to the downtown area that also offered some walking opportunities and wasn' t too expensive. We trusted in Trip Advisor ratings, and took a chance on the Vagabond Inn despite some negative reviews. The Vagabond Inn is a little run down but generally well kept. We stayed for three days in mid-January seeking the sun and warmth (we're from Wisconsin). We had a 2Q N/S room on the second level overlooking the outdoor poor. The entire time we stayed we never saw anyone in the pool, but is was kept heated and well maintained. The price we paid for the off-season was reasonable. Housekeeping was pretty good, and the rooms were clean. It was surprising quiet with the windows closed and drapes pulled. Almost all the rooms overlook the parking lot of a seafood store with a small cafe. Store hours were from 9 to 6, but delivery trucks and garbage trucks started early, so don't expect to sleep past 7AM. Evenings were generally quiet. The location and Inn was just what we wanted. We could walk to Shelter Island, enjoyed seeing the private and commercial boats, and were within easy walking distance of some interesting and affordable cafe's, deli's and restaurants. (When you check in ask for dining recommendations, we received a complementary discount at Miguels, which was very good.) Additionally, the downtown area with many attractions, as well as the ocean, were only minutes away by car. If you want to experience a real ocean side harbor experience I would highly recommend the Point Loma area. We were able to see two aircraft carriers, several large naval ships, military aircraft, and two large cruise ships, all in the same harbor on the same day. However, the downside is that is was a very noisy area, not far from the flight path of the airport's one runway, and with lots of activity on the road, in the harbor, and in the skies. Our three days there was a great experience, but we were happy to move north for the rest of the triip to the Pacific Beach area. )See my review for the Pacific Shores Inn).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: broadbill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vagabond Inn for four nights during November.The place is situated right next to Point Loma,an excellent location for fishermen who are heading out on the long range fleet,which I was. Taxi fare was eight dollars from the airport. The staff were polite and very helpful,which,after a trip of sixteen hours from the UK was appreciated. The room I stayed in was both clean and comfortable.I would say that the place is very good value for money and I will definatly use this hotel next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very well kept and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: MisterMVA
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel but I must say it did live up to the positive reviews I read before we left. The price was kind of high but a lot lower than other places in San Diego. It is located very close to Shelter Island -- you can walk there and both Ocean beach and Point Loma are a short drive away. It's also a quick drive to the water to see the sun set over the Pacific. There are some good takeout restaurants nearby as well. I also found a takeout place with really great grilled fish tacos (Wahoo I think it was called - it's a chain but it was a bit of a drive from the hotel). As far as the room goes, it was small but clean and everything worked. There is a pool around which most of the rooms are centered. Our teenage daughter absolutely loved this pool eventhough it seemed kind of small to me. There were lots of things to play with in the pool (don't know if they belonged to the hotel or one of the guests). The breakfast was good. Parking was a bit tight but we didn't have to park on the street. We did see several folks with pets so I assume the allow them there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience at the Vagabond Inn Point Loma!”
Reviews.Author: flowera
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here!!!! We booked at this location during our move to San Diego from out of state. Since we were moving with our two cats, we needed a pet friendly place to stay. We chose the Vagabond Inn Point Loma. Upon our arrival, we received a rude greeting and it only continued from there. When we asked a question about why they needed to photocopy my husband's driver's license and credit card, the answer was given quite rudely and the front desk person proceeded to treat us poorly. We then discovered additional pet charges and a ridiculous pet policy. The most ridiculous part of the policy was that at a pet friendly hotel, we were not allowed to leave our pets (our cats) alone in the hotel room. We were in the process of moving, we needed to be at work, we needed a pet friendly hotel so that our pets could be somewhere while we worked. Instead, it seemed the expectation was that we'd either stay in the room or put our animals in the car all day. We found that to be completely inhumane. We'd already paid for the hotel through travelocity and worked with them to try to get our money back. Vagabond was going to charge us for all 7 days but after discussing it with Traveloctiy changed their policy to charge us for 4. Technically, we'd only stayed for 1 night. The Vagabond's slogan is, "Great Value, friendly people". We wholeheartedly disagree with this assertion!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Smelly, Moldy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I tried to stay in this motel with my wife and my coworker and his wife. We checked in and explored the area a bit. When we came back we realized how bad the rooms were. Our bathroom had a tub with cracks in it that seemed to seep water through the floor. It almost looked like soggy particle board. My coworkers room had a terrible stench of mold that was not noticed when we arrived. The manager kid showed them another room that smelled even worse. He calimed that "he had no sense of smell" and couldnt tell that the rooms stank. We left for the Best Western (very nice by the way), which was more pricey, but after the Vagabond, we didn't care. The Vagabond tried to charge us for one room, since we didnt make the bed. Jerks. This experience made me want to avoid the Vagabond Inn altogether. I have seen much better rooms for much cheaper. Stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and it Shows”
Reviews.Author: HappyH
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Vagabond Inn in Point Loma California for a three night stay in San Diego. I had read about this place in the Mobil Travel Guide, which recommended it as inexpensive and clean. I can say that those two terms together were correct. But what they didn't say was run down. The location was great - it is located behind the docks next to the Point Loma Seafood's restaurant. We walked to dinner a few nights and other nights, sat at the tables outside after the restaurants closed with a bottle of wine and watched the fishing boats come in. It was also interesting in the morning to walk over and see the overnight boats come in and unload the fish from the boats. When we checked in, we had booked our room right through the Vagabond Inn's website. The room was supposed to be $79 and $89 per night. We arrived with another couple who booked their room on Travelocity. They got a room in the back of the hotel - we were given a room right next to the office, which was noisy and inconvenient. We requested a room in a different area and were charged an additional $15 per night. Since we clearly did not want the noise next to the office, we grudingly paid the extra money. Our room was on the second floor. The room was clean and a decent size, but the dresser was very worn. The bathroom, while clean, had a peeling bathtub. (So did our friends' room). There was mismatched bath tiles on the wall and the tub faucet leaked. The beds were comfortable and the showers nice and hot, but if you are a bath person, stay away - the peeling of the tub was very off putting. There was a small pool that was located directly on the main road of Scott Street. If it doesn't bother you to swim where traffic from the road is only a few feet away from you, this won't bother you. Most of the clerks were friendly, but on one occasion an overnight female desk clerk ignored us while she was on the phone with her boyfriend when we were trying to get so information from her. There is a coffeemaker in each room but ours had a broken top on the pot. There is also none of that powder in the rooms to lighten the coffee if you make it, so we just got coffee in the main office as a continental breakfast was provided, as well as free newspapers. Our friends had a refrigerator in their room and a microwave, ours did not. When we inquired about it, the clerk told us that's just the way it was - some rooms had them, some didn't and they couldn't do anything about the rooms that didn't have them. That was a little off putting - all rooms should be consistent in this travel agents opinion. The parking lot was very small in the hotel. If you went out and came back after 9:00 PM, you usually had to park on the street. This hotel is ideal for anyone who is going on a few days of fishing - the location is right next to the boat docks and it was cheap. We loved Point Loma but will go an extra $20 or $30 next time and stay at another hotel in Shelter Island. When we checked out, a friendly clerk asked where we were going next and we told him San Luis Obispo. He told us there is another Vagabond Inn there and he'd be happy to make us a reservation - we said thanks but no thanks - our experience with staying at a Vagabond Inn is over for this lifetime. If you search hard, you can find much better for another $20 per night - I wouldn't recommend this chain from our experience.

Reviews.Title: “just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, here we go. We just got back from San Diego, just a 5 day trip to hang at the beaches and relax. We cut it short one day, because we just weren't comfortable in our hotel. Let me start off by saying the whole staff from the front desk to the cleaning staff were VERY VERY nice, and helpful. However, the rooms lacked in appeal and need MUCH updating. We did notice that most (if not ALL) of the hotels/inns in the area were pretty much the same, and i guess by being spoiled in the past when staying in San Diego this was not what we were expecting, nor from the excellent reviews this motel got. There were ants in the bathroom, the tub just looks gross, no way was i going to go without wearing shoes or socks on that rotten-cheese smelling carpet, and they told us upon check-in that we were ''upgraded'' ... well i would hate to see the regular version...the area is nice and relaxing however, and there is a great restaurant called Pizza Nora just a short walk away. Like some others have said the area is safe enough, and the staff is VERY nice and friendly, but the room itself and the appearance of the place are not worth $95 a night...and don't be fooled by the ''free breakfast'' it consists of a coffee machine and a toaster in the front lobby...but again i can't emphasize enough that the staff were friendly, the pool was clean, and if all you are looking for is a place to lay your head at night, then you've got it, but i would definitely not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: Turfite
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is just a motel, but with something extra. My wife and I stayed for 5 nights and had towels and bed linen changed each day we were were there. The rooms were kept very clean. Staff, day or night, were very friendly and the complimentary breakfast was just fine. For those who wanted larger breakfast there is a Denny's within easy walking distance. The location suited us as we flew into Lindbergh Field which is only a couple of miles away and hired a car. We were at the hotel in no time. Shelter Island is a great place to walk in the early morning or late evening and not too far away. Lots of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and it is in a good location with easy access to the rest of San Diego, be it beaches or downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good prices, very clean, location near the pier. Cons: Small rooms, very modest breakfast, the restaurant parking lot at the back of the hotel can be rather noisy early morning, uncomfortbale bed. Though you get a good value for your money here, it is nothing more than a regular budget motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Lee L
Reviews.Content: I gave this motel the rating due to the price. I paid $60 after tax to stay New Years Eve and found the motel to be clean and comfortable. A free continental breakfast and being next door to Point Loma Seafood's is key. Eat there! This property is close to great restaurants and right next to the landing if you are going fishing. The pool was heated and the room had a small refer and a microwave. The staff was polite and friendly. A bargain!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great location”
Reviews.Author: Escape_to_sun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vagabond Point Loma for 5 days in August and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location was close to aiport and was a convenient base for our explorations. There were several nice restauraunts within walking distance. Immediately behind the hotel is a "picnic style" seafood resturant and the sport fishing harbor. It was a fun place to hang out and watch the activity. The hotel is not fancy, but it was quiet, the rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. I would definately return. Check their website for special rates.

HotelInfo.Name: Vagabond Inn San Diego (Point Loma)
HotelInfo.Address: 1325 Scott Street, San Diego, CA 92106
